At Lindley Elementary, children‚Äôs book author/illustrator Kyle T. Webster drew on his teaching experience to motivate students, actively helping them find their talents for delight and a possible career.

The award-winning author/illustrator showed his picture book, ‚ÄúPlease Say Please!," about an elementary school girl who learns that life is better (and sometimes even magical!) when she remembers to say ‚Äúplease‚Äù with ease in a happy rhyming presentation.

Webster engaged students at lunch, encouraging them to share their work, as he provided constructive observations. His work has appeared in major publications such Atlantic, The New York Times, New Yorker, Scholastic and Wall Street Journal.

Heidi stands out above the rest. She is well known for her innovation, work ethic, follow-through, positive attitude, collaborative spirit, and she is a natural leader and mentor. Heidi is respected among her peers as a person they can go to for help and be inspired when they need a thought partner. She handles all that is thrown her way with grace and compassion. Throughout the time I've known her, she has demonstrated time and again that she is a positive, motivated leader who makes a difference to her students and community. She is an amazing asset to our team and we feel lucky to have her.
